attributes.action: Prevent payment of EU ‘exit fee’ until a beneficial trade deal has been ratified
attributes.background:
The Government has offered to pay up to £39bn to the EU as an exit fee despite there being no legal requirement to do so.
Put it into law that not a penny should be paid until a final trade deal with demonstrable benefits to the UK economy has been signed and ratified by all EU member states.

attributes.action: Order immediate adjournment of the Brexit process during the NCA Investigation
attributes.background: The NCA is investigating criminal offences relating to electoral law on the behalf of Brexit supporting campaigners.
attributes.additional_details:
This is serious enough to warrant a view that the 2016 referendum result should be questioned.
 
Therefore the process should be adjourned while the facts and position are investigated.
 
http://www.nationalcrimeagency.gov.uk/news/1498-nca-initiates-investigation-following-electoral-commission-referral
 
https://www.electoralcommission.org.uk/our-work/roles-and-responsibilities/our-role-as-regulator-of-political-party-finances/sanctions/report-on-investigation-into-payments-made-to-better-for-the-country-and-leave.eu

attributes.action: An Opt Out system with the Bone Marrow Register and more awareness in Education.
attributes.background:
Every day at least 5 people start their search for a bone marrow donor. There are currently only 2% of people in the UK registered. This compares to 13% in Cyprus, 12% in Israel and 9% in Germany.
90% of donations take place via peripheral blood stem cell (PBSC) collection, similar to giving blood.
attributes.additional_details:
Organ donation is highlighted with public campaigns as is blood donation. Both saves lives. Bone Marrow Donation is not. It needs more public awareness, more understanding within the communities and schools. It must be made compulsory within the school age of 14-16 years. It can reduce concerns and highlight the simplicity of the procedure, which will potentially save someone's life ! 
There should be an 'Opt Out' system where those who wish to not donate can remove themselves from the register.

attributes.action: Stop animals being used for street entertainment in order to gain money
attributes.background:
Animals are being used by buskers to gain money should be banned!
Animals are being abused, and treated cruelly
Any animal being used for street entertainment should be jailed and dogs siezed
attributes.additional_details: Dogs have been siezed by the rspca for abuse, ill health over the past two years already 17 dogs have been siezed, some through heat exhaustion, urine infections due to not being allowed to pee in the same place, they are wacked by their leads, water bowls are for show only, they are beaten back at base and also drugged this is no life for any animal, this has to stop!!

attributes.action: Counsellors on wards where 16 to 25-year-olds are receiving cancer treatment
attributes.background: Counsellors should be available for young people receiving cancer treatment. When I was diagnosed with cancer, it was a complete shock for me and my family. I found it harder to deal with mentally than the actual treatment itself.
attributes.additional_details: Despite being treated on a specialist adolescent unit for 16 to 25-year-olds, no counsellor is available for people in this age group. I and others would benefit from a counsellor being on wards and instantly available. The counsellor could then deal with any worries as they arise, and people would not need to wait for appointments in the community.

attributes.action: Confirmed date for National Rollout of voluntary right to buy
attributes.background: There have been numerous regional trials for the VRTB which have all been used to stall a national roll out of the scheme. Our voices are ignored, all question go unanswered. It's time we were given the same rights as council tenants as promised in the Government's 2015 manifesto.

attributes.action: Make education about littering and its effects compulsary in all schools.
attributes.background: My name is Osian,  I am 17 and have Autism and anxiety.  I have volunteered in the Peak District for 4 years. The peace of the moors has saved my life and I want to do all I can to protect them.   The epidemic of littering and fly tipping is ruining the countryside and is a danger to wildlife.
attributes.additional_details: I am the National Trust Youth Volunteer for 2018 and want to use my award to promote my campaign. I believe that the only way to make a real difference with litter is to start with children.  I hope that they will grow up and teach people around them to also not drop litter. What we learn as a child we never forget.  I want every child to participate in an education programme that will result in a Certificate from the Government and sign a promise to not drop litter and look after their world.

attributes.action: Press the United Nations to make the dumping of all waste in the oceans illegal.
attributes.background: The only way to stop the polution of the oceans by plastic and other waste is to stop the dumping of urban waste at sea. The attempts that are being made to remove plastic and other waste from the oceans will only start to be effective once the dumping has stopped.

attributes.action: Redistribute 30 hours childcare funding to subsidise costs for children aged 1-4
attributes.background:
The current childcare funding is not available until a child is three years old. Consequently, there is a funding gap between the end of maternity leave and the start of the 30 hours funding. 

I propose we redistribute the funding to provide 15 hours childcare per week for children aged 1 to 4.
attributes.additional_details:
All parents are eligible for 15 hours funding for children aged 3 and 4. 

Families where both parents are working are eligible for an additional 15 hours funding for children aged 3 and 4. 

The current gap in childcare funding for children aged 1 and 2, means that childcare costs are one of the greatest barriers for parents returning to work. 

I propose we redistribute this entitlement so that families where both parents are working are eligible for the funding for children aged 1 and 2.

attributes.action: Drop the EU Withdrawal Agreement on the basis that it is unconstitutional.
attributes.background: The EU Withdrawal Agreement (EUWA) stipulates that we will have no representation in the EU Parliament while mandating we still pay VAT at rates limited by the EU. This means British citizens will be taxed without representation which is unconstitutional and may set a "taxes for deals" precedent.
attributes.additional_details: VAT was introduced on joining the EEC. It replaced the similar Purchase tax to avoid double taxation. VAT is therefore an EU mandated tax, irrespective of whether the EU is the main beneficiary or because it's collected by HMRC. The EU control the rate for competition reasons between member states and will retain ultimate jurisdiction in the UK over it. This is not a petition to "get rid of" VAT, but against the ramifications and precedents the EUWA may have on our fundamental rights

attributes.action: Ban plastic wrappers for individually sold greetings cards.
attributes.background:
Reducing single use plastic should be priority for all of us. 

This petition is over the use of plastic wrapping for individually sold greeings cards. 

Greetings card and envelopes are already sold without the need for plastic wrapping in a number of shops. This should be made mandatory.

attributes.action: Open Family Courts up to public scrutiny
attributes.background: Family Court proceedings are not transparent. They are conducted away from public scrutiny. As a result there is little public awareness of the injustice many families experience and little accountability for poor judicial decisions. Anyone should be able to attend a Family Court hearing.
attributes.additional_details: The public interest lies in understanding how the law is being dispensed with regards to children and their parents. It lies in understanding the impacts these decisions have on our society. Hundreds of thousands of cases a year pass through the Family Courts unchecked with victims having no redress outside of cost prohibitive appeals to the Royal Courts of Justice. Public scrutiny of the system is required to ensure the process is efficient and protects the rights of both children and parents.

attributes.action: Introduce reduced flexible working hours for breastfeeding parents
attributes.background:
There are benefits to mother and child for extended breastfeeding with the WHO recommends breastfeeding for the first 2 years of life. 
Many women find the return to work makes continuing breastfeeding difficult, other countries have support in place for this to continue.
attributes.additional_details:
Many other countries have support in place for breastfeeding to continue, eg Portugal has a 'breastfeeding license' which reduces the working day by 2 hours, this would allow a mother the optiond to arrive later, leave earlier, pop home during the day to feed or to use the time during the working day to pump to provide milk for when they are away.

Many women need to return to work and a change like this would allow them to provide financially as well as physically for their child.

attributes.action: People found with a knife to get 10 years and using a knife 25 years in prison.
attributes.background: People are scared of the amount of knife crime with apparently very little deterent to stop people carrying knifes.

attributes.action: Make employment businesses that supply electrical workers require a licence.
attributes.background:
Employment businesses/agencies that supply labour within the electrical trade are notorious with breaking the rules.

One of the most common problems is workers not being paid or having deductions made from there wages, both of which are illegal practices!
attributes.additional_details:
The EWB Propose a licensing system similar to the GLAA (http://www.gla.gov.uk/) to help protect the workers from these unfair practices.


The law is very clear on what an employment business/agency can and can't do but as it stands it is difficult to bring them to justice.

With a licence in place it makes the jobs of unions such as the IWGB:EWB easier to fight for fairness for workers.

Its time for change within the electrical industry and these unfair practices that break the law to change.

attributes.action: Legalise cannabis for medical and recreational use.
attributes.background:
Legalise cannabis for medical and recreational use.
It is time for the government to accept that cannabis should be legal. Prohibition has done nothing to reduce drug use and it is hypocritical for the government to allow alcohol and tobacco

attributes.action: Reduce the council tax for people who live in park homes
attributes.background: Other than refuse collections, park owners pay through their ground rents for their own lighting, roadworks, street cleaning, drainage and other services.  Many Councils also receive license fees from site owners that are also paid for by the occupiers

attributes.action: Make British Sign Language a GCSE option in UK Secondary Schools.
attributes.background: We are a group of Young People working with NCS the National Citizen Service and out Social Action project is working with the Morley Street Sensory needs resource centre in Bradford, our work here has inspired us to petition the government to make sign language an optional GCSE to raise awareness.
attributes.additional_details: British sign language being taught in UK schools to all young people would help communication between deaf and non deaf communities and would provide a useful tool for young people in their education.

attributes.action: Make Keeping Dogs & Domestic Animals on Allotments Sites a Criminal Offence.
attributes.background:
Dogs & Domestic Animals are bred & kept alone on allotments in conditions in contravention of the 5 Freedoms of the Animal Welfare Act.
Animals, only discovered by chance among inaccessible enclaves of dilapidated sheds, often dead or dying;unsupervised, they are vulnerable to fire & random attack.
attributes.additional_details:
http://politicalanimal.org.uk/wp-content/uploads/2014/11/Welfare-of-animals-on-allotments.pdf
 .. Animals must not be kept on allotments, or anywhere else, unless their welfare needs can be provided for (as set out in the Animal Welfare Act 2006)
https://www.thenorthernecho.co.uk/news/15522360.greyhounds-were-kept-in-ramshackle-conditions-on-an-allotment https://www.gazettelive.co.uk/news/teesside-news/man-claims-animals-seized-lazenby-9527688

attributes.action: Make recycling free for all schools in England.
attributes.background: Currently, schools are expected to pay in order for the council to take away their recyclable waste. I propose that all schools in England are given free recycling and that it is made mandatory that they should dispose of all of their waste in the most environmentally conscious way possible.
attributes.additional_details: I am the leader of my school's eco-club and I have been campaigning for there to be facilities where we can recycle our plastic waste for the past two years. Due to a tight budget and the council's insistence that we pay for them to dispose of our recycling we have been unable to get such facilities.

attributes.action: Require airlines to carry small pets in aircraft cabin on flights to the UK
attributes.background:
Ever tried going on holiday with your best friend? 
Unfortunately for pet owners that live in the UK the options are limited: 1. leave your dog in a kennel (If family/friends is not an option) 2. take your pet with you and return via ferry or car 3. ship your pet as cargo in the hold.
attributes.additional_details:
Putting a pet in cargo (if your pet is not snub nosed like mine) is very risky and traumatic, especially for long flights. For those with pets that comply with cabin regulations, it is simply unnecessary to either not be able to fly into Britain or have to leave a pet behind for an extended period of time. 
Why are we able to fly out with pets in cabin and not back into the UK? 
The British are among the biggest animal-lovers in the world. Let's make it easier to enjoy family holidays together!

attributes.action: stop all eu low skilled migrants from entering the uk after we leave the eu
attributes.background:
It has become apparent that following the Home Office White Paper that eu  low skilled immigrants will still be allowed to enter the UK after Brexit. This is not taking back control of borders and is not respecting the Referendum result or the Tory Manifesto.

This petition was rej

attributes.action: Establish a dedicated Select Committee on Climate Change.
attributes.background: The rise in atmospheric CO2 since pre-industrial times has caused the climate to warm and start potentially irreversible changes to the environment
attributes.additional_details:
Examples of what Parliament needs to be able to challenge: 
1. Encouragement of aviation by approving the 3rd runway at Heathrow, and failure to tax aviation fuel appropriately. 
2. Endorsing and funding road infrastructure instead of on-shore and offshore wind turbine projects. 
3. Withdrawing support for the Swansea Bay Tidal Project lagoon. 
4. Nursing the new fracking industry(which releases the more hazardous methane as well as CO2) in spite of the need to keep fossil fuels underground.

attributes.action: Free prescriptions for transplant recipients
attributes.background: Transplant patients are on immune suppressants and anti-rejection medication for the rest of their life. As with a lot of other illnesses, they shouldn't have to pay for them.

attributes.action: Pay all government in-house & outsourced staff the real living wage
attributes.background:
Thousands of employees working for the government earn under the real living wage - currently £10.55 p/hour in London & £9.00 p/hour outside of London.

All workers deserve at least the living wage & the government should be leading by example ensuring that in-house & outsourced staff receive it.
attributes.additional_details: Currently nearly 3,000 workers at the Ministry of Justice (MoJ) earn below the real living wage, as do hundreds of workers who are outsourced at the MoJ such as security guards, cleaners and receptionists. They are now taking strike action through their union United Voices of the World (UVW), as are outsourced staff through PCS Union at the Department of Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy (BEIS) simply because the government won't listen and refuses to pay them a wage they can live off.

attributes.action: Make baby CPR compulsory in all antenatal classes within the hospitals
attributes.background:
As it stands parents have to pay to undergo a course to learn how to give CPR and how to deal with choking in infants and babies. 

After losing our son, we believe that no parent should have to pay to learn this skill.
attributes.additional_details:
We were taught how to give CPR and how to deal with choking when we were discharged from the neonatal unit as Johnny had been ill. This was part of their discharge procedure, however other parents are not taught this before leaving the hospitals. 

Our antenatal classes did not teach this basic skill either and all parents should be given the right on knowing what to do in an emergency.

attributes.action: Make retailers that sell drinks sell at least 30% of them in non plastic.
attributes.background:
Plastic is causing catastrophic effects in the environment we all live in. 
So why do many large, and small High Street retailers still sell ONLY plastic bottles of drinks? 
If there is a choice, people will be able to choose to not have plastic. The % should increase 10% each year for 4 years.
attributes.additional_details:
In our local NHS hospital a large multinational retailer only sells plastic bottled drinks.
A local chain of bakeries only sells drinks in plastic bottles.
There is already too much recyclable plastic that isn't recycled in the world. Drinks bottles use New plastic, not recycled plastic. Cutting down on New plastic for these drinks bottles will cut down the plastic that will then enter into the environment. 
Quicker, and easier to implement that a plastic bottle refund scheme.

attributes.action: Fund Research to Prevent and Treat Asherman's Syndrome.
attributes.background: In 2009, I was pregnant with my one and only pregnancy. At my three-month scan, I was told there was no heartbeat and that I needed to have an ERPC. Following this I was diagnosed with Asherman's Syndrome, which then caused me to become infertile. This Silent Syndrome has been recognised since 1948.
attributes.additional_details: Asherman's Syndrome is scarring (adhesions) of the uterus. This scarring causes lighter periods or no periods at all and, in almost all women who are affected, infertility. It most often develops after a common minor operation called a D&C (dilation and curettage) and often following a missed miscarriage. In this case it's called an ERPC (evacuation of retained products of conception). It is estimated that around 60,000 - 100,000 D&Cs are carried out each year and many women remain undiagnosed.

attributes.action: Intruduce Commercial Dog Walking to be a licensed and inspected profession
attributes.background: Commercial dog walking has become massive in recent years and it would appear that nothing is required to practice. Some do provide excellent service to help our dogs have a better life whilst we are at work etc however there are many who walk no limit of dogs, do not clean up and intimidate others.
attributes.additional_details: Whilst using the South Downs on a regular basis I come across many dog walkers. They walk up to 8 dogs individually & not all on leads. Myself & my dog find when the dogs approach intimidating & quite often do not clear up after the dogs or have control. Something needs to be put in place for the sake of the general public who want to walk their dogs without the worry of feeling intimidated when walking the downs or any public space. Kennels & Boarders are licenced & inspected & must be trained & insured to protect OUR pets.A license should be a requirement to allow Authorities to inspect vehicles used to transport dogs, check on insurance and the walkers experience. Numbers walked commercially must also be limited.

attributes.action: Give the state pension to terminally ill people at early age
attributes.background: I’ve paid into the pension since 1976 and I’ve now got only a few years to live. I’m 58 now, but can’t get my pension. Who gets it when I die? The government. This is not fair.
attributes.additional_details: I’ve got motor neurone disease. I’ve no life because I have no memories to create with my partner and 16 year old daughter, because I have no free money left to do this. Getting my pension early would be a great help.

attributes.action: Home Office to confirm right to work on applications by way of acknowledgement
attributes.background: Those who work within the legal profession are aware that section 3C Immigration Act 1971 allow applicants who submit in time applications the right to reside and work in the UK whilst their applications are pending. Employers are  requesting for written confirmation by way of acknowledgement.
attributes.additional_details:
Family Members of EEA Nationals are issued such letters by way of Certificate of Application. Home Office should simplify the process by issuing Certificate of Application for immigration applications to help laymen, employers and employees.

The two tier system is causing confusing and individuals are being suspended from work unjustifiably and this can be resolved by the Home Office adopting the Certificate of Application style for all British linked immigration applications.

attributes.action: Urge Russia to free British Citizen Paul Whelan from Moscow Prison
attributes.background: Our brother and cousin, Paul Whelan, a loyal, compassionate and loving member of our family, was arrested in Moscow on December 28th and is currently being held at the high security Lefortovo prison.
attributes.additional_details:
Paul regularly travels across the globe and has enjoyed visiting Russia as he has a keen interest in the language and culture. On this occasion he travelled to Moscow to attend a friend’s wedding and has been arrested on suspicion of spying. Paul is NOT a spy. We are extremely worried about him and want to see his immediate release.

Due to the workings of the Russian court system, he could be held for years before a trial or sentencing. His family in both the United Kingdom and the United States are working behind the scenes to ensure that Paul has access to legal representation and that his basic needs are met. He is currently being held in isolation and we fear for his mental health.

attributes.action: Longer sentences for dangerous driving!
attributes.background: Our dad was killed in a hit and run accident on 29th Oct 2018. Dad was a proud father, loving husband and caring grandfather. We will miss dad everyday and our lives have  changed forever.  People drive dangerously without thinking how this will effect somebody's life. Photos & memories all we have.
attributes.additional_details:
We need tougher sentencing to ensure that people's lives are not taken away by such irresponsible actions.  We the victim's family have to live with this for the rest of our lives.  But the culprits will end up in prison for such a short time, usually only completing half their sentence.   

The culprits will then be allowed to move forward with their lives once they have been released.  They will be able to rehabilitate themselves into society.  But what about the victim's family?

attributes.action: Force the supermarkets to provide refill station for all basic groceries.
attributes.background: Most of groceries are bought in single use plastic packaging. It should be possible for everyone to buy all his/her groceries without unnecessary packaging. Supermarkets should provide at least their own brand groceries in dispensers where customers have to bring their own containers to fill them.
attributes.additional_details:
This should include the following: rice/pasta, cereal/ flour, spices/salt, loose tea/coffee, oils, shampoo/conditioner/hand wash, washing liquid, laundry liquid/powder/fabric conditioner.
Plastics are difficult to recycle because there are so many types that have to be separated.
Plastic can be recycled 7-9 times before it is no longer recyclable.
Paper can be recycled 4-6 times. Glass, steel and aluminium lose no quality during recycling and can be recycled endlessly.
According to Defra: less that 50% of UK's waste is recycled.
According to British Plastic Federation: Overall 32% of plastic is recycled and 46% for plastic packaging.  
According to British Plastic Federation the waste hierarchy should be as follows: Prevention, Preparing for reuse, Energy recovery, Disposal.

attributes.action: Enable an Emotional Support Animal to be recognised as an Assistance Dog.
attributes.background: In America service dogs cover both physical and mental health needs. Anxiety is a mental health condition that can cripple the people who suffer from it many of whom struggle to go outside let alone have a life that is equal to non-sufferers. Same goes for depression. So why can they not have help.
attributes.additional_details: The definition given by the government website for disability is to have a physical or mental impairment that has a substantial/long-term negative effect on ability to do normal daily activities. Anxiety, depression and other mental health illnesses fall under this and yet service dogs are not allowed. Dogs are important for people with mental health and allowing them to go everywhere with the person, like a guide dog, such as shops and restaurants allows the person to become a more active member of society.

attributes.action: Grant healthstores a business rates dispensation
attributes.background: Independent healthstores play a vital role in supporting preventative health, saving the NHS millions of pounds annually.  As valuable assets who invest in the health of their local communities, healthstores deserve the same recognition and dispensation of £1000 currently awarded to Public Houses.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to use parent-child spaces if you do not have a child with you
attributes.background: I would like parent-child spaces to be considered with the same respect as disabled spaces and be offered as a matter of course in all public car parks. As a mother of 2 infants I am left to struggle getting them out of the car in an unsafe space because people without a child use the child spaces.
attributes.additional_details: There is a safety issue as the extra space allowed in a child space means children can get in and out safely without being right next to the moving wheels of other vehicles. Additionally, these spaces are often closer to the trolley park or business entrance meaning if you have to get a special trolley to use or are carrying infants you don't have to go too far from the car in order to be able to do this safely. Having to carry children, baby bags and your shopping is very difficult already!

attributes.action: Provide funding to Staffordshire County Council to reduce a £35 million deficit
attributes.background: Staffordshire County Council has already slashed running costs by £240 million in 9 years. There is a further forecast £35 million reduction that will see much needed services for Staffordshire people reduced or even removed. Therefore we are asking the UK Government to provide adequate funding.
attributes.additional_details:
Here are just a few of the proposed cuts: 

• School crossing patrols
• Review cost of children’s resident provision
• Review alternative autism funding
• Review of Victoria Centre of history grant 
• Removal of non-statutory community transport 
• Removal of concessionary travel before 09.30 
• Reduction in grants to voluntary community social enterprise
• Review of Adult learning disability provisions to remove preventive services
• Review remaining financial support for hate crime

attributes.action: Immediately amend the future carbon budget targets
attributes.background:
The latest IPCC report, SR15, details the significant change of circumstances which have take place since the Climate Change Act of 2008.
We therefore need to amend the fourth carbon budget target to 60% by 2025 and the fifth to 70% by 2030.
attributes.additional_details: see http://www.ipcc.ch/report/sr15/

attributes.action: NOT to ban the sale of fireworks to the public
attributes.background: Fireworks bring joy to many people of all ages and it is part of a tradition that goes back hundreds of years. Banning fireworks will not only ruin our Guy Fawkes tradition but will also have a massive impact on our multi cultural celebrations to such as diwali.

attributes.action: Reinstate Pension/Income Letters at Bangkok British Embassy
attributes.background:
As of the 12th of December 2018 British Citizens can no longer request a proof of income letter required to obtain a Retirement or Extension based on marriage visa in Thailand

Other Countries Embassy's have an option to sign an affidavit that your income is true.
attributes.additional_details:
The British Embassy has stated that this is because the Thai Immigration require proof that they cannot provide yet the current income letter already covers the embassy legally.  

The British Embassy has left us to resolve this with Thai immigration

The Thai immigration has not made any announcement and still requests the letter. Failing this retired or married Brits may be forced to transfer between £9-18,000 to a Thai bank as proof

attributes.action: NHS Allocation of Funds for PFO Closure in Selected Ischaemic Stroke Patients
attributes.background: Young and unsuspecting people suffer from stroke due to a hole in their heart called a PFO. There is a straight forward procedure scientifically proven to be statistically significant in reducing secondary stroke in these patients. The NHS does not currently allocate funding for this procedure.
attributes.additional_details:
Here are some links to relevant research: 

http://www.onlinejacc.org/content/69/11_Supplement/1260

http://www.onlinejacc.org/content/56/13_Supplement/B108.3

Professional boxer Dan Sarkozi is an example of an unsuspecting victim of cryptogenic stroke. Dan suffered a cryptogenic stroke due to a hole in his heart which was originally believed to be a PFO. He faced the proposition of losing his career and spending his life on blood thinning medication due to lack of funding for this procedure.

attributes.action: The Government must publish its own Brexit Impact/Risk Assessments
attributes.background: We are heading towards the end of the A50 period and only 6% of MPs have read them. On that basis they can't be that important or hinder the negotiations, therefore releasing them to the public won't be a problem.
attributes.additional_details: This was previously debated but times have changed.

attributes.action: Lift the UK Travel Advisory on Direct Flights to Sharm-El-Sheikh
attributes.background: The UK is one of the only European nations refusing to lift its advisory against 'all but essential air travel to and from Sharm-El-Sheikh'. DIVE Magazine is calling for the restrictions placed on one of the UK's best-loved destinations, especially by divers, to be immediately rescinded.
attributes.additional_details: Prior to the Russian airline disaster of 2015, UK tourists constituted the second-highest percentage of visitors to Sharm. Loss of the UK market had a devastating impact on Egyptian workers, local businesses, and UK tour operators - and continues to do so. Over £20million has been invested in updated airport security. The resort itself is deemed to be safe. Almost every other European nation is flying. It's been more than 3 years. It's time to lift the 'ban'

attributes.action: Make it compulsory to learn how to pass equines safely,&include the highway code
attributes.background:
Educate new drivers about how to approach & overtake equines safely on the road.
Slowing down to a safe speed & passing with least 2m space.
Understand arm signals should a rider signal.
Safe passing can save lives.
Educate horse riders to wear hiviz and be seen.
attributes.additional_details:
The Glow Means Slow Campaign was created to help raise awareness to equestrians of how important it is to wear HiViz when out on the roads and rural lanes.
This is due to the rise In more accidents resulting in death and near misses lately between motorists and equines.
HiViz gives a driver between 3-5secs better reaction time.
A spooked horse can react at speeds up to 50mph.The recognised speed when injuries are more likely to result in death.

attributes.action: Don't charge food businesses 20% VAT on turnover
attributes.background: I want the government to stop charging food businesses 20% VAT. The reason for this is because our industry has barely any VAT to claim back and yet we get charged that 20% on our turnover which is unfair compared to other industries. This ruins cash flow and causes business owners financial issues.

attributes.action: UK Government to ban the import of shark fins into the UK.
attributes.background:
73 million sharks killed every year for shark fin soup, sharks are thrown back to the sea where they will die after having their fins brutally cut from their bodies.
 Loopholes are allowing people to continue smuggling fins in to the U.K despite a ban put in place in over 27 countries in 2013.

attributes.action: Avoid no deal Brexit
attributes.background: The government has let us down with its negotiations with the EU and we are heading for a no deal scenario, which leaders in all fields say will be hugely damaging to the UK in many areas of life, from health to air travel to food imports. We must avoid a no deal situation.
attributes.additional_details: We need to accept we need more time to organise our departure from the EU and request an extension to the article 50 process. This will give the UK time to continue talks, hold an general election or seek further opinion from the public to determine how Brexit should proceed.  Most importantly we will avoid a damaging no deal scenario which will harm poor and vulnerable people the most

attributes.action: Increase use of restorative justice for adult offenders
attributes.background: Restorative Justice gives the victim the chance to have a meeting with their offender. In order for the meeting to take place, all of the parties have to agree to participate. The meeting is assisted by a mediator, and the aim is to discuss the offence and its consequences as a group.
attributes.additional_details: Researches show that RJ satisfies 85% of the victims and reduces the re-offending rate by 14% [https://restorativejustice.org.uk/criminal-justice]. Young offenders are offered RJ where appropriate, but this does not occur enough for adult offenders. We would like the government to introduce legislation that makes it mandatory to offer RJ to adult offenders where appropriate. Please sign if you agree that this would be a positive move forward for victims, offenders and the Criminal Justice per se. #RJ4EVERYONE

attributes.action: Increase the cycle to work scheme limit from £1000 to £2000.
attributes.background: Introduced in 1999, the scheme allows workers to buy a bike and accessories through their workplace. If the scheme’s limit had tracked inflation it would now be over £1,600. In addition, e-bikes are now becoming popular, provide access to cycling to more people, but are even more expensive.
attributes.additional_details:
Some organisations have obtained permission from the FCA to provide loans to a higher limit, but many do not do this (e.g. due to the complexity of obtaining permission and costs).

This is a timely petition as officials from DfT, HMT and HMRC are reviewing the scheme’s guidance (including the limit) as part of the Government’s Cycling and Walking Investment Strategy.
